A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like:
Nonstop progressive propaganda.
From blundering male characters to feminist hairstyles\, vegan Chewbacca and saving the animals\, smashing and looting the rich and off-putting colloquialisms. 
TLJ messes up basic Star Wars lore\, Yoda looks worse than any Yoda yet put on screen\, the story is rambly and even absurd. Your favorite characters from TFA will take a second seat to the new cast of social justice warriors\, and all your questions from the last movie will go unanswered as we open plot holes the size of buckets between sheets of plot armor.
Adam Driver's visceral and relatable portrayal of Kylo Ren was incredible\, singlehandedly making this movie 25% watchable. The other 75% was the most disappointing cinema experience I have ever had in my life. I was so frustrated with the palpable agenda that I felt like crying\, and the question "what the f### is happening" began to lose its meaning. 
Unbearably disappointing.
